subSubSection.paragraph:
Material studied. Lectotype
, male ( MNHN ): “ Madagascar , Sud, Andrahomana, Alluaud 1900 ”; “ Type
Selinus abacoides
”, “Museum Paris 1906 Coll. Léon Fairmaire”. Other material :
3 males
and
4 females
, differing only by the “code label” ( CASC ): “ MADAGASCAR : Toliara Prov. Parc National d`Ardohahela, Forêt d`Manantalinjo, 33.6 km 63 º ENE Amboasary, 7.6 km 99 º E Hazofotsy,
12 – 16
I 2002
”, “
24 º 49 ` 1 ``S
46 º 36 ` 36 ``E
coll: Fisher, Griswold et al. California Acad. of Sciences, shifted litter – in spiny forest thicket, elev 150m , BLF 4810 ” “CASENT 8029523 ”, “CASENT 8029522 ”, ”CASENT 8037176 ”, ”CASENT 8028488 ”, ”CASENT 8027615 ”, ”CASENT 8037179 ”, ”CASENT 8037177 ”. Female: “ MADAGASCAR : Toliara Prov., Forêt de Mahavelo, Isantoria River, elev 110m ”,
24 º 45 ` 30 ``S
46 º 9 ` 26 ``E
,
28 Jan – 1 Feb 2002
”, “coll: Fisher, Griswold et al. California Acad. of Sciences, shifted litter (leaf mold, rotten wood) – spiny forest thicket, code: BLF 5238 ”, “CASENT 8027610 ”. Female: “ MADAGASCAR : Toliara Prov. Parc Nat. d`Ardohahela, Forêt d`Ambohibory, 1.7 km 61 º ENE Tsimelahy, 36.1 km 308 º NW Tolagnaro,
16 – 20
I 2002
”, “
24 º 55 ` 48 ``S
46 º 38 ` 44 ``E
, coll: Fisher, Griswold et al. California Acad. of Sciences, at light – in tropical dry forest thicket, elev 300m , code: BLF 4919 ” “CASENT 8029830 ”. Male and female: “ MADAGASCAR , Fort Dauphin,
13.10 – 20.10
. 1987 , P. u. H. Schüle”.
2 males
: “ MADAGASCAR , Ampoasary,
22.10 . 1987
, P. u. H. Schüle”; female ( MNHN ): “ Madagascar Sud. Andrahomana, Alluaud 1900 ”, “Muséum Paris, 1906 , Coll. L. Fairmaire”. Female ( MNHN ): “Manantantely, nr. Ft. Dauphin, Madagascar ,
VI- 15-35
”, “HKlrby Collector”, “Van Dyke collection”, “
Lechius abacoides (Fairmaire)
, Det.
D. Iwan. 1995
”. Female ( MNHN ): “
Selinus abacoides Fairmaire
”, “
Selinus abacoides Fairmaire, Dr Z. Kaszab
det.”, “ Madagascar Sud. Andrahomana, Alluaud 1900 ”.

Redescription. Measurements. Body—length = 13.0 – 14.0 mm; width ratio elytra/pronotum ca.1.0; length ratio elytra/pronotum (pl) =
2.2 – 2.4
. Clypeus—clypeal emargination width/depth ratio ca. 6.0. Antennae—length ratio antenna/pronotum (apl) ca. 0.9 ; ratio length of antenna/width of 3 rd antennomere ca. 6.3 ; length ratio of antennomere 3 rd/ 2 nd ca. 3.0. Maxillary palp—ratio width of maxillary palp/length of 3 rd antennomere ca. 1.0. Pronotum—pronotum length (pl)/width ratio ca. 0.6 ; length ratio pronotum (pl)/anterior pronotal angles (apl) ca. 0.9 . Elytra—elytra length/width ratio ca. 1.3 . Scutellum—width ratio anterior margin of elytra/scutellum at base =
5.1 – 5.2
. Metaventrite—length ratio cavity of hind coxa/metaventrite between the insertions of mid and hind coxae ca. 2.6 . Abdomen—width ratio process of I abdominal ventrite/process of metaventrite ca. 2.0. Legs—male protibia length/width ratio ca. 5.8 ; female protibia length/width ratio ca. 7.5 ; both sexes profemur length/width ratio = 4.0 – 4.1 . Tarsi—length ratio metatarsomere 1 st/ 2 nd ca. 2.0.

Head punctures sparse (
3 – 4
diameters apart) with setae (Fig. 3 ). Anterior margin of clypeus with shallow median emargination. Mentum slightly narrowing towards apex; submentum with elongated base (Fig. 32 ).

Elytral rows with scarcely visible punctures; most noticeable at the elytral base (
Fig. 14
). Interrows dull with scarcely visible punctures (
5 – 6
diameters apart) (
Fig. 14
). Elytral base strongly sinusoidal. Elytral humeri rounded. Scutellum triangular.

Intercoxal process of prosternum straight with complete bordering (same as in
L. longiclavis
sp. nov.
,
Fig. 17
). 5 th abdominal ventrite bordered; with punctures
4 – 5
diameters apart.

Male protarsi widened. Male protibia similar as in
L. longiclavis
sp. nov.
(Figs 6, 7) Meso- and metatibia of both sexes simple.
Apical part of aedeagal tegmen equal to 0.25 of the rest of tegmen. Parameres narrowing towards apex. Clavae short (Fig. 25 ).
Paraproct longer then coxites. First two sclerites wide and short; remaining sclerites narrow and long. Spermatheca as in Fig. 29 .

Comments. Following sampling periods (a), habitat descriptions (b) and altitudes (c) were recorded from specimen labels: (a)
15 VI 1935
,
13 – 20 X 1987
,
12 – 16 I 2002
,
16 – 20 I 2002
,
28 I – 1 II 2002
; (b) Spiny forest thicket (leaf mold, rotten wood), tropical dry forest thicket (at light); (c) 150m , 110m ,
300m .
